title: Software Engineer
description:
**About The Job**
 Red Hat's UXE Platform Engineering Team is looking for an Software Engineer to join us. In this role, you will inspire and work with a team of dedicated software engineers. You will be part of a team that is focused on software development. You will be responsible for full stack development.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer, you will also work with the Quality Engineering (QE) , Dev\\-Ops, other development teams and other stakeholders to ensure quality deliverables.
   

  

**What Will You Do**
* Work on and implement, Java Spring Boot based applications and modules
* Worked on either REST or GraphQL
* Created or worked on middleware infrastructure like SSO, Enterprise Bus, Queues and similar
* Effective communicator who provides feedback on their deliverables
* Work with technical leads on architecture, code reviews and supporting the team
* Work on creating and managing the dev ops infrastructure.
* Creating build and deployment pipelines integrating gitlab and openshift in Managed plus platform.
* Migration of jenkins pipeline to gitlab
* Effective communicator who provides feedback on their deliverables
* Work with technical leads on architecture, code reviews and supporting the team


**What Will You Bring**
* Knowledge of OpenShift platform
* Knowledge of Gitlab/Github managed CI/CD
* Knowledge of Kubernetes and Docker
* Knowledge of messaging apps API services and their usage.
* Good knowledge of App Services and middleware technologies
* Ability to support front end applications and knowledge of frameworks like React.
* TDD approach and UX mockups would be an added advantage.
* Quick Learner who can get quickly onboarded and start contributing
* Stakeholder engagement to ensure queries are responded on time
* Previous experience in maintaining existing modules that have short SLAs and are time sensitive in case of outages and vulnerabilities
* Strategic insights to ensure right features are prioritized
* Good communication skills to work with the team
* Ability to work independently with other teams to foster collaboration
* 3\\-4 Years of experience required
* Good verbal and written communication skills in English


**About Red Hat**
 Red Hat is the world’s leading provider of enterprise open source software solutions, using a community\\-powered approach to deliver high\\-performing Linux, cloud, container, and Kubernetes technologies. Spread across 40\\+ countries, our associates work flexibly across work environments, from in\\-office, to office\\-flex, to fully remote, depending on the requirements of their role. Red Hatters are encouraged to bring their best ideas, no matter their title or tenure. We're a leader in open source because of our open and inclusive environment. We hire creative, passionate people ready to contribute their ideas, help solve complex problems, and make an impact.
   

  

**Inclusion at Red Hat**
 Red Hat’s culture is built on the open source principles of transparency, collaboration, and inclusion, where the best ideas can come from anywhere and anyone. When this is realized, it empowers people from different backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences to come together to share ideas, challenge the status quo, and drive innovation. Our aspiration is that everyone experiences this culture with equal opportunity and access, and that all voices are not only heard but also celebrated. We hope you will join our celebration, and we welcome and encourage applicants from all the beautiful dimensions that compose our global village.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Policy (EEO)**
 Red Hat is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative action employer. We review applications for employment without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, veteran status, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, marital status, or any other basis prohibited by law.
   

  

 Red Hat does not seek or accept unsolicited resumes or CVs from recruitment agencies. We are not responsible for, and will not pay, any fees, commissions, or any other payment related to unsolicited resumes or CVs except as required in a written contract between Red Hat and the recruitment agency or party requesting payment of a fee.
   

  

 Red Hat supports individuals with disabilities and provides reasonable accommodations to job applicants. If you need assistance completing our online job application, email application\\-assistance@redhat.com. General inquiries, such as those regarding the status of a job application, will not receive a reply.

title: Associate Software Engineer- Java
description:
**Associate Software Engineer**
**Let's talk about the team and you:**
 ResMed is a global leader in sleep and respiratory care, transforming lives with innovative products and technologies. We empower people to take control of their health and live the best lives they can. This internship provides an opportunity to gain hands\\-on experience, delve into the dynamic field of software development, and engage with real\\-world projects that significantly contribute to our successes.
   

  

**Are you ready to code with purpose?**
 If you're a passionate learner with a good experience in programming, we encourage you to apply! Join us and unleash your coding potential while making a difference in healthcare.
   

  

**Let’s talk about Responsibilities:**
 The primary role of Engineering function within Product Development team is to create specifications and designs for new products or improvements and enhancements to existing products. Works closely with customers, developers and other stakeholders to understand and define customer needs in these designs. Features are aligned to a timetable and areas of responsibility.
   

  

 Developers may solicit customers for feedback regarding product usability and desired future enhancements. Software Engineers who design, write and test code for the product should be matched in either Software Engineering Applications or Systems. Product developers who specialise in hardware systems should be matched to Hardware Engineering.
   

  

 As an Associate Software Engineer, you will have the opportunity to work closely with other senior developers to contribute to the software development life cycle. You will work alongside talented professionals, learning best practices and gaining insights into different development approaches to do:
   

  

* Design, develop and test software; Verify software behaviour meets requirements through manual and automated tests; Deliver quality product within timeline; Document product design; Analyse, debug and help resolve customer issues; Collaborate and communicate effectively with all stakeholders required.
* Explore diverse technologies: Expand your skillset with a range of languages, frameworks, and tools based on our specific needs.
* Problem Solving: Assist in the identification and resolution of software defects and issues.


**Let’s talk about Qualifications \\& Experience:**
* Master's degree in a relevant field (IT, Computer Science)
* Proficiency in a programming language (e.g., Java).
* Good understanding of software development principles and design patterns.
* Knowledge of web development technologies (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).
* Exposure to software testing concepts and methodologies.
* Good understanding of Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) processes.
* Good understanding of development tooling such as Visual Studio.
* Great interpersonal relations, team cooperation, and communication skills
* Exceptional organisational and collaboration skills
* Exceptional communication skills and interest/enthusiasm for the healthcare industry


 Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging, supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals, but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture, encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you, apply now! We commit to respond to every applicant.

title: Junior Data Engineer
description:
IMEA (India, Middle East, Africa)
   

  

 India
   

  

 LIXIL INDIA PVT LTD
   

  

 Employee Assignment
   

  

 Fully remote possible
   

  

 Full Time
   

  

 1 November 2025
   

  

**Title:** 
**Data Engineer**
**Overview**
 A Data Engineer plays a crucial role in designing, building, and maintaining the infrastructure that powers our data\\-driven decisions. You’ll be at the heart of our data ecosystem, ensuring data is reliably collected, stored, and processed to provide clean, accessible data for our analytics and business intelligence teams.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design \\& Develop Data Pipelines: Assist in building, maintaining, and optimizing scalable ETL/ELT data pipelines to ingest and transform large datasets from diverse sources, including APIs, databases, and third\\-party systems.
* Data Modeling \\& Warehousing: Support the development of robust data models and schemas in both relational and cloud\\-native data warehouses (e.g., Google BigQuery).
* Ensure Data Integrity: Monitor, troubleshoot, and improve the performance and reliability of data pipelines, ensuring data quality, consistency, and accuracy.
* Data Source Integration: Work with various data formats and sources, including structured, semi\\-structured, and streaming data.
* Data Governance \\& Security: Collaborate with senior engineers to enforce data governance, quality, and security standards across the organization.
* Code \\& Automation: Write clean, efficient, and well\\-documented code (SQL, Python) for data engineering tasks. Utilize Git and CI/CD principles for version control and automated deployments.
* Team Collaboration: Document data workflows and contribute to a shared knowledge base, providing ad\\-hoc support to data analysts and business users.


**Required Skills \\& Experience**
* Educational Background: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Engineering, or a related field.
* Professional Experience: 1\\-3 years of hands\\-on experience in a data engineering or similar role.
* Technical Proficiency:
* Communication \\& Soft Skills:
* Availability: Able to join immediately.

description:
**Company Description**
**NEC Software Solutions (India)**
 On 1st July 2021, Rave Technologies became NEC Software Solutions India. This change brought us under the global NEC Corporation brand. We are proud to be part of an organisation with 122 years of experience in evolution with technology and innovation.
   

  

 We have more than 30 years of experience in providing end to end IT services across the globe and have earned a reputation for delighting our customers by consistently surpassing expectations and helping them deliver robust, market\\-ready software products that meet the highest standards of engineering and user experience. Supported by more than 1300 exceptionally talented manpower, we are a hub for offshore support and technology services.
   

  

 We work with diverse industry verticals which include publishing, media, financial services, retail, healthcare and technology companies around the world. Our customers range from two\\-person startups to $bn listed companies.
   

  

 For more information, visit at www.necsws.com/india.
   

  

**About NEC Corporation**
 NEC Corporation is a Japanese multinational information technology and electronics company, headquartered in Tokyo, Japan. It is recognised as a ‘Top 50 Innovative Company’ globally and the NEC Group globally provides “Solutions for Society” that promote the safety, security, fairness and equality of society. Their main goal is to help create a safer society with their innovations in technologies.
   

  

 NEC Corporation has established itself as a leader in the integration of IT and network technologies while promoting the brand statement of “Orchestrating a brighter world.” NEC enables businesses and communities to adapt to rapid changes taking place in both society and the market as it provides for the social values of safety, security, fairness and efficiency to promote a more sustainable world where everyone has the chance to reach their full potential.
   

  

 For more information, visit NEC at https://www.nec.com.
   

  

**Job Description**
 Experience\\- 2\\-4 yrs
   

  

 Location\\- Mumbai\\- Hybrid
   

  

**Duties to be performed**
**Approximately 80% of workload**
*

+ Work with the environments/implementation team to setup deployment toolkits at customer site.
+ Work on deployment issues and its resolution.


**Approximately 20% of workload**

+ Patching and upgrade of existing applications
+ Investigate and resolve, or minimise the impact of recurring issues


**General**
*

* Self starter, resilient to pressure and able to work in a multi\\-paced, change oriented environment


**Qualifications**
**BE, BTech**

title: Software Engineer II - DevOps Engineer
description:
**Job Description**
 You’re ready to gain the skills and experience needed to grow within your role and advance your career — and we have the perfect software engineering opportunity for you.
   

  

 As a Software Engineer II at JPMorgan Chase within the Consumer \\& Community Banking Team you are part of an agile team that works to enhance, design, and deliver the software components of the firm’s state\\-of\\-the\\-art technology products in a secure, stable, and scalable way. As an emerging member of a software engineering team, you execute software solutions through the design, development, and technical troubleshooting of multiple components within a technical product, application, or system, while gaining the skills and experience needed to grow within your role.
   

  

 Job responsibilities
   

  

* Executes standard software solutions, design, development, and technical troubleshooting.
* Designs, develops, codes, and troubleshoots with consideration of upstream and downstream systems and technical implications..
* Applies technical troubleshooting to break down solutions and solve technical problems of basic complexity.
* Gathers, analyzes, and draws conclusions from large, diverse data sets to identify problems and contribute to decision\\-making in service of secure, stable application development.
* Design, implement, and manage AWS infrastructure to support scalable and reliable applications.
* Collaborate with development teams to integrate and automate deployment processes.
* Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues using tools like Splunk, Dynatrace, and Grafana and implement observability practices to ensure comprehensive monitoring and alerting and to enhance system reliability and performance.
* Provide hands\\-on production support and resolve incidents promptly.
* Develop and maintain documentation for infrastructure and operational processes.
* Participate in on\\-call rotations to ensure 24/7 system availability.
* Adds to team culture of diversity, opportunity, inclusion, and respect


**Required Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills**
* Formal training or certification on software engineering concepts and 2\\+ years applied experience
* Experience as a DevOp Engineer
* Experience in developing, debugging, and maintaining code in a large corporate environment with one or more modern programming languages and database querying languages.
* Experience across the whole Software Development Life Cycle.
* Experience with continuous integration and continuous delivery tools like Jenkins, GitLab, or Terraform and Application Resiliency \\& Security.
* Emerging knowledge of software applications and technical processes within a technical discipline (e.g., cloud, artificial intelligence, machine learning, etc.).
* Strong experience with AWS infrastructure and services.
* Proficiency in logging, monitoring and observability tools such as Splunk, Dynatrace, and Grafana.
* Hands\\-on experience in production support and incident management.
* Ability to work in a fast\\-paced and dynamic environment.


**Preferred Qualifications, Capabilities, And Skills**
* Familiarity with modern front\\-end technologies
* Exposure to cloud technologies AWS
* Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and automation tools
* Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash)

title: Documentation Engineer
description:
**Company Description** 








 Ogive Technology is recognized in the aerospace and defense ecosystem for delivering exceptional solutions for governments, services, and defense sectors. The company specializes in cutting\\-edge technologies such as Predictive Maintenance, HUMS (Health and Usage Monitoring Systems), Simulation, VR\\-based solutions, and customized warehousing and inventory management systems. Their innovative solutions are tailored to meet the needs of ships, aircraft, and other defense and security platforms. Ogive continues to advance its offerings, ensuring high\\-quality outcomes for its clients.
 



  





**Role Description** 








 This is an on\\-site contract role for a Documentation Engineer, based in Lucknow. The role involves creating and managing comprehensive technical documentation, including manuals, operation guides, and technical write\\-ups. The candidate will be responsible for organizing, reviewing, and editing existing documentation and collaborating with engineers and project teams to ensure accuracy, clarity, consistency, and usability of the technical content. The engineer will also engage in quality checks to ensure the documentation aligns with industry standards and project requirements.

* Proficiency in Technical Documentation and Document Management
* Strong skills in Technical Writing and creating detailed Manuals
* Experience in comprehensive Documentation creation and maintenance
* Excellent attention to detail, organizational, and communication skills
* Ability to work collaboratively with technical teams to translate technical details into easily understandable documents
* Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Technical Writing, or a related field
* Familiarity with defense and aerospace industry standards is an advantage
* Proficiency in relevant software tools for document creation and formatting is a plus

title: Salesforce CPQ Specialist
description:
**It's fun to work in a company where people truly
 **BELIEVE** 
 in what they're doing!**
*We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.*
**Job Title: Salesforce CPQ Specialist**
**Team: Enterprise Technology**
**Location: Remote (EST Time Zone)**
**About the Role:**
 Avid is seeking a technical and strategic Salesforce CPQ Specialist to join our Enterprise Technology team. We are looking for a self\\-motivated expert to own and advance our Quote\\-to\\-Cash (QTC) processes within a complex B2B and B2C sales organization. This role is pivotal in architecting, configuring, and optimizing our Salesforce CPQ platform to drive sales efficiency and accuracy. You will take the lead on implementing best practices, ensuring the platform is scalable, and serving as the go\\-to subject matter expert for all things CPQ.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Architect and implement scalable, best\\-practice solutions to support complex product catalogs, bundling, pricing structures, and renewal/amendment processes.
* Architect and Develop Complex Pricing Logic: Design, build, and maintain sophisticated Price Rules, discount schedules (volume, term, etc.), and pricing guidance. This includes implementing conditional logic and utilizing custom lookup tables for dynamic pricing.
* Serve as the primary technical Subject Matter Expert (SME) for Salesforce CPQ, guiding business stakeholders and development teams on best practices, feasibility, and solution design.
* Design and maintain complex Salesforce configurations including Flows, validation rules, page layouts, and Lightning pages to support the end\\-to\\-end Quote\\-to\\-Cash lifecycle.
* Lead requirements gathering workshops and solution design sessions with business users to translate complex business needs into scalable technical CPQ solutions.
* Develop and maintain comprehensive technical documentation, solution designs, and best practice guidelines for the CPQ and Quote\\-to\\-Cash processes.
* API Integration Development: Develop and maintain integrations between Salesforce CPQ and other critical business systems, such as ERPs (Netsuite), contract lifecycle management (CLM) platforms, using REST and SOAP APIs.
* Perform complex data analysis and extraction using SOQL, Dataloader, Workbench, and other tools to support CPQ data integrity, reporting, and strategic projects.
* Proactively monitor CPQ system performance, data integrity, and licensing to ensure the platform is scalable and efficient.
* Manage the deployment of CPQ configurations and custom code across sandbox and production environments, leveraging CI/CD pipelines and tools to ensure release integrity.
* Collaborate closely with Sales, Finance, Marketing, and other cross\\-functional teams to ensure the CPQ solution aligns with broader business objectives.


**Qualifications:**
* BA/BS degree in a technical field or equivalent work experience.
* 5\\+ years of hands\\-on Salesforce experience, with at least 3\\+ years specifically focused on implementing and managing Salesforce CPQ.
* Proven expertise in the end\\-to\\-end Quote\\-to\\-Cash lifecycle, including complex product and pricing structures, bundling, discounting, quoting, contracting, amendments, and renewals.
* Deep technical proficiency with CPQ objects, Product Rules, Pricing Rules, Advanced Approvals, Quote Templates, and the Salesforce data model.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce platform capabilities, limitations, and governance best practices.
* Experience with CPQ integrations to ERP (e.g., Netsuite) and other business systems is a significant plus.
* Excellent communication skills with the ability to translate complex technical concepts for non\\-technical stakeholders and lead requirement sessions.
* Ability to work effectively in the EST time zone (Amer/New York).


*If you like wild growth and working with happy, enthusiastic over\\-achievers, you'll enjoy your career with us* 
*!*

title: Systems Engineer - Global IT Operations Center
description:
IMEA (India, Middle East, Africa)
   

  

 India
   

  

 LIXIL INDIA PVT LTD
   

  

 Employee Assignment
   

  

 Not remote
   

  

 Full Time
   

  

 2 June 2025
   

  

 Lixil India is Hiring for System Engineers \\- Global IT Operations Center at Gurgaon Location
   

  

**This is a 6 day a week, and 3 shifts role.**
**This Position Will Be Responsible For**
* Continuously monitor system alarms from all kinds of IT devices in LIXIL
* Respond to critical and major system alarms on a 24x7 basis
* Follow documented processes and procedures to resolve common issues related to software, hardware, and networks
* Escalate complex or unresolved issues to Tier 2 or Tier 3 support as needed
* Maintain accurate and detailed records of user interactions and troubleshooting steps in the ticketing system
* Provide monitoring and KPI reports regularly and upon request
* Ensure adherence to SLAs (Service Level Agreements) and other performance metrics
* Participate in training and development to stay updated on new technologies and procedures
* Collaborate with other Digital team members to ensure seamless support operations
* Set up and maintain alarm monitoring tools and KPI dashboard under the supervision of senior engineers
* Handle and solve IT simple incidents by referring SOPs or KEDB (Know Error Database)
* Handle and solve IT simple tasks by referring SOPs or KEDB (Know Error Database)


**Qualifications**
* High school diploma or equivalent; a degree in Information Technology or a related field is a plus
* Experience in a customer service or technical support role
* Excellent communication skills, ability to explain technical concepts to non\\-technical users
* Strong problem\\-solving skills and the ability to follow documented procedures
* Basic understanding of computer systems, networks, and software applications
* Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously
* Familiarity with ticketing systems, preferably Jira, is an advantage
* Willingness to work some shifts and weekends if necessary
* Experience in a multi\\-tiered support environment
* IT certifications (e.g. CompTIA A\\+, ITIL Foundation) are a plus
* Minimum 1\\- 3 years of Working experience / Freshers having relevant IT Certifications (e.g. CompTIA A\\+, ITIL Foundation)
* Please note that this position requires working in Shifts
* Role may require flexibility, including working different hours, weekends, or holidays, to provide global support coverage

* Handle and solve IT tasks related to IT Services such as Network, Server, Cloud etc. by referring SOPs or KEDB (Know Error Database)
* Graduation or equivalent; a degree in Information Technology or a related field is a plus

* Shift working required and mandatory; 6 days a week on a rotational basis
* Role may require flexibility, including working different hours, weekends, or holidays, to provide global support coverage
